dimensions.description: Google Analytics only accepts numbered dimensions like `dimension3` and `dimension19`. When you `analytics.identify(userId, traits)` with custom traits, we need to map those traits to Google Analytics dimensions. Enter a trait name on the left, and the Google Analytics dimension you want on the right. Email [friends@segment.io](mailto:friends@segment.io) if you need help!

domain.description: If you set the domain name, then _only data sent from visitors on that domain_ will be recorded. [Read our docs here](/docs/integrations/google-analytics/#cookie-domain-name). By default Google Analytics will resolve the domain name automatically, so you should **leave this blank unless you know you want otherwise**! This option is useful if you need to ignore data from other domains, or explicitly set the domain of your Google Analytics cookie. This is known as Override Domain Name in [GA Classic](https://developers.google.com/analytics/devguides/collection/gajs/gaTrackingSite). If you are testing locally, you can set the domain to `none`.
domain.label: Cookie Domain Name
validators: Please enter a valid domain (don't include `http://`). It should be blank or look something like this: `sub.example.com`.

doubleClick.description: This works with both Universal and Classic tracking methods.

enhancedLinkAttribution.description: If you want more detailed reports on the links clicked on your site, you might want to enable this feature. Read more about it [here](https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/2558867?hl=en).

Universal profiles can [edit their ignored referrers](https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/2795830?hl=en&ref_topic=2790009) directly inside Google Analytics._

Enter a property or trait name on the left, and the Google Analytics metric you want on the right. Email [friends@segment.io](mailto:friends@segment.io) if you need help!

optimizely.name: Optimizely
optimizely.note: Optimizely works differently than other integrations. Their javascript is synchronous, so you'll need to drop their javascript snippet onto the page outside of Segment as the first item in the head tag. As soon as you do that, we'll send custom events through to Optimizely to help you measure A/B test conversions, and we'll pass the A/B test experiment variations through to your other tools for deeper downstream analysis.
optimizely.description: Optimizely is a dead-simple A/B testing tool that lets your marketing team test changes on your website in a WYSIWYG editor without having to write any code. Segment will pass events and traits to Optimizely, and send experiment variations to other tools.

trackCategorizedPages.label: Track Categorized Pages

trackNamedPages.description: This will track events to Optimizely for [`page` method](https://segment.io/libraries/analytics.js#page) calls that have a `name` associated with them. For example `page('Signup')` would translate to **Viewed Signup Page**.

allPagesMtId.label: Conversion ID for all pages

events.description: Configure a conversion pixel

fields.description: Mediamath allows you to track conversions. When you `analytics.track('my event')` we will map that event to the `mt_id` and `mt_adid` that you provide. We'll map other data like properties to s and v parameters below.
fields.label: Event Name
validators: please enter a custom event name

fields.description: Enter the `mt_id` that you want us to send when this conversion event is triggered.
fields.label: mt_id

fields.description: Enter the `mt_adid` that you want us to send when this conversion event is triggered.
fields.label: mt_adid

fields.description: Map event properties to vParameters and we'll insert the value of that property in the corresponding query parameter of the MediaMath Pixel. Email [friends@segment.io](mailto:friends@segment.io) if you need help!
fields.label: V-Parameters

fields.description: Map event properties to sParameters and we'll insert the value of that property in the corresponding query parameter of the MediaMath Pixel. Email [friends@segment.io](mailto:friends@segment.io) if you need help!
fields.label: S-Parameters

events.label: Events

localytics.name: Localytics
localytics.description: Localytics is a general-purpose mobile analytics tool that measures customer acquisition, ad attribution, retargeting campaigns and user actions in your mobile apps.

appKey.description: You can find your App Key in your Localytics [Settings page](http://www.localytics.com/).
appKey.label: App Key
validators: Please enter your Localytics App Key.
Please double check your API Key. It should be 22 characters long, and look something like this: `3ccfac0c5c366f11105f26b-c8ab109c-b6e1-11e2-88e8-005cf8cbabd8`.

dimensions.description: Localytics only accepts custom dimensions that have been pre-set in your app. Make sure to set these up in Localytics first, under Settings > Apps and then editing your app settings. You should then map the `trait` in an identify call or the `property` in a track call to the corresponding custom dimension you want to send. For e.g. you might map `gender` with custom dimension `0`. You can read more about custom dimensions [here](http://info.localytics.com/product-news/custom-dimensions-for-user-segmentation)
dimensions.label: Custom Dimensions

sessionTimeoutInterval.description: If an App stays in the background for more than this many seconds, start a new session when it returns to foreground.
sessionTimeoutInterval.label: Session Timeout Interval
validators: Please double check your Timeout Interval. It should be a whole number.

framed.io.name: Framed.io
framed.io.description: Retain users with machine-enhanced intelligence. Use Framed to predict when customers will leave and save them before they go.

freshdesk.name: Freshdesk
freshdesk.description: Freshdesk enables companies to provide multichannel support via phone, email, chat, website, social networks and mobile apps

apiKey.description: Go to your profile settings page and your API key will be available below the change password section to your right
apiKey.label: API Key

subdomain.description: The site subdomain. So if your domain is `segment.freshdesk.com`, insert `segment`
subdomain.label: Subdomain

clientsuccess.name: ClientSuccess
clientsuccess.description: ClientSuccess develops a customer success management platform to revolutionize the way companies manage, retain, and grow their existing customer base

apiKey.description: You can find your API key in ClientSuccess under the top right menu, Apps & Integrations > Usage
apiKey.label: API Key

apiSecret.description: You can find your Project Id in ClientSuccess under the top right menu, Apps & Integrations > Usage
apiSecret.label: Project Id

wootric.name: Wootric
wootric.description: Wootric collects customer feedback inside your web application using the Net Promoter Score. Track ongoing NPS, follow up with customers, and quickly surface insights in an easy-to-use dashboard.

accountToken.description: You can find your account token in your Wootric Settings under 'Install JS Beacon'. It should look something like this: `NPS-4aeb53c1`.
accountToken.label: Account Token
validators: Please enter your Wootric account token

route.name: Route
route.description: Route allows you to convert your leads into customers and your customers into great customers

organizationId.description: You can find your Route organization id under Setup. It should look like `553e9be8ab3e3a16d07b1232`
organizationId.label: Organization Id
validators: Please enter your Route organization id

elevio.name: Elevio
elevio.description: Use elevio to show an entire knowledge base, on every page of your site.

accountId.description: You can find your account ID on your elevio widget settings page.
accountId.label: Account Id
validators: Please enter your Elevio account id

convertro.name: Convertro
convertro.description: Convertro helps marketers understand where to allocate budget across channels at the most granular level, to maximize ad performance and accelerate growth

account.label: Account
validators: Please enter your Convertro Account Name.

events.description: Convertro only wants to receive specific events. For each conversion event you want to send to Convertro, put the event name you send to Segment on the left, and the name you want Convertro to receive it as on the right.
events.label: Events

hybridAttributionModel.description: This will make **Completed Order** events always send a `sale` event in addition to a `sale.new` or `sale.repeat` event if it has a boolean `repeat` property.
hybridAttributionModel.label: Hybrid Attribution Model

seg.name: Seg
seg.description: Seg generates clever profiles for your customers from your orders, website traffic and email clicks which you can use to send relevant emails through your existing email software.

apiKey.description: You can find your Website Id under your Seg app settings > Web tracking code. It should look like `abc8fb18-7559-4324-9921-a4b5015b4a1c`. Note that you do not need to install any extra tracking code.
apiKey.label: Website Id

taplytics.name: Taplytics
taplytics.description: Taplytics is an A/B testing tool for iOS. Taplytics enables you to create A/B tests visually, or in code, without waiting for App Store updates.

apiKey.description: You can find your API Key under **Project Settings** in the upper-left of the [Taplytics interface](https://taplytics.com).
apiKey.label: API Key
validators: Please enter your Taplytics API Key.
Please double check your API Key; it looks like it's misspelled. It should be a 40 character hexadecimal number.

delayLoad.description: Seconds to keep showing the splash screen until the experiments are loaded. Used for when running an experiment on the first page of the app.
delayLoad.label: Delay Load (iOS)

pushSandbox.description: Configures whether the push token for the device is a production token or if it is a development token.
pushSandbox.label: Push Sandbox (iOS)

shakeMenu.description: This will control whether the in-app Shake Menu is enabled or not.
shakeMenu.label: Enable Shake Menu (iOS)

cubitic.name: Cubitic
cubitic.description: Cubitic's predictive analytics platform transforms big data into actionable intelligence.

gosquared.name: GoSquared
gosquared.description: GoSquared offers real-time user-level analytics for sites and apps. With people analytics, powerful filtering, events and e-commerce tracking, GoSquared puts all your user data in one place.

anonymizeIP.description: Enable if you need to anonymize the IP address of visitors to your website.
anonymizeIP.label: Anonymize IP

apiKey.description: Generate your server-side API key here: https://www.gosquared.com/settings/api
apiKey.label: API Key (Server-side)

apiSecret.description: You can find your Site Token by viewing the GoSquared [Integration guide](https://www.gosquared.com/integration/). It should look something like `GSN-123456-A`.
apiSecret.label: Site Token
validators: Please double check your Site Token; it looks misspelled. It should look something like this: `GSN-951209-L`.

cookieDomain.description: Use this if you wish to share GoSquareds tracking cookies across subdomains, `.example.com` will enable shared tracking across all examples subdomains. By default, cookies are set on the current domain (including subdomain) only.
cookieDomain.label: Cookie Domain
validators: Please enter a valid domain name like `.example.com` or `example.com`

trackHash.description: Enable if you'd like page hashes to be tracked alongside the page URL. By default, `example.com/about#us` will be tracked as `example.com/about`.
trackHash.label: Track Hash

trackLocal.description: Enable to track data on local pages/sites (using the `file://` protocol, or on `localhost`). This helps prevent local development from polluting your stats.
trackLocal.label: Track Local

trackParams.description: Disable to ignore URL querystring parameters from the page URL, for example `/home?my=query&string=true` will be tracked as `/home` if this is set to disabled.
trackParams.label: Track Parameters

useCookies.description: Disable this if you don't want to use cookies
useCookies.label: Use Cookies

curebit.name: Curebit
curebit.description: Curebit is a social marketing platform for ecommerce stores that increases revenue through referrals.

campaigns.description: Each campaign runs at a specific url like /share or /invite. Map that url to the Curebit campaign_tags for that page.
campaigns.label: Campaigns

customUrl.description: If Curebit supplies a custom URL from which to load your script, enter it here and we'll use that instead of the default. Please include the `//` prefix.
customUrl.label: Custom Script URL
validators: Please double check the custom URL. It should start with `//`.

device.description: What device should it be sized for? If you're not sure see this [Help Page](https://curebit.helpjuice.com/questions/45313-Where-do-I-find-my-site-ID) from Curebit.
device.label: Device Sizing

iframeBorder.description: Your IFrame Border, if you're not sure see this [Help Page](https://curebit.helpjuice.com/questions/45313-Where-do-I-find-my-site-ID) from Curebit.
iframeBorder.label: IFrame Border

iframeHeight.description: Your IFrame Height, if you're not sure see this [Help Page](https://curebit.helpjuice.com/questions/45313-Where-do-I-find-my-site-ID) from Curebit.
iframeHeight.label: IFrame Height

iframeWidth.description: Your IFrame Width, if you're not sure see this [Help Page](https://curebit.helpjuice.com/questions/45313-Where-do-I-find-my-site-ID) from Curebit.
iframeWidth.label: IFrame Width

insertIntoId.description: The ID of the HTML element where you would like to insert the Curebit IFrame.
insertIntoId.label: ID to Insert Curebit

responsive.description: Should the IFrame be responsive? If you're not sure see this [Help Page](https://curebit.helpjuice.com/questions/45313-Where-do-I-find-my-site-ID) from Curebit.
responsive.label: Use a Responsive IFrame

server.description: You can use your own domain if you have an enterprise Curebit account
server.label: Server
validators: Please enter a valid domain name, like `company.com`.

siteId.description: Your Site ID, if you can't find it see this [Help Page](https://curebit.helpjuice.com/questions/45313-Where-do-I-find-my-site-ID) from Curebit.
siteId.label: Site ID

interstate-analytics.name: Interstate Analytics
interstate-analytics.description: Interstate helps marketers understand their ROI across all channels, campaigns, and devices in a single dashboard, so they can make better marketing spend decisions.

chartbeat.name: Chartbeat
chartbeat.description: Chartbeat is a real-time dashboard for your team. It lets you see how many users are browsing around the different parts of your site or mobile app in real-time!

domain.description: The same domain name you entered when adding your site's dashboard to Chartbeat. Don't include the `www.` because Chartbeat handles that for you automatically.
domain.label: Domain
validators: Please enter your Chartbeat site's domain name.
Don't include the `www.` because Chartbeat will handle that for you automatically.
Please enter a valid domain name, like `company.com`.

uid.description: You can find your UID on the Chartbeat [Adding The Code](https://chartbeat.com/docs/adding_the_code/) page.
uid.label: UID
validators: Please enter your Chartbeat site's UID.
Double-check your UID. It should be a series of numbers, like `98923`.

video.description: If you select this option, we'll load `chartbeat_video.js` instead of `chartbeat.js`. The video library has the ability to listen for play/pause events from HTML5 `video` tags and common 3rd party video players.
video.label: Use Chartbeat Video Script

track-js.name: Track JS
track-js.description: JavaScript Error and Event Tracking for Modern JavaScript Websites and Applications.

application.description: Optional. The name of the section of your application that this Segment project encompasses. For more info [see here](https://docs.trackjs.com/Examples/Multiple_Applications)
application.label: Application Key

callbackBindStack.description: Whether TrackJS should record the stacktrace for how a callback came to be bound, allowing the creation of an 'async stacktrace' in the TrackJS UI. This gives you more context of how the application arrived at the function that failed. Enabling this has a nontrivial performance penalty, test before enabling in production
callbackBindStack.label: Callback BindStack

callbackEnabled.description: Whether TrackJS should watch for errors on host-function callbacks, such as addEventListener, and setTimeout. Disabling this greatly decreases the likelihood of recording a stacktrace for an error.
callbackEnabled.label: Callback Enabled

consoleDisplay.description: Whether calls to console.log and other console functions should be displayed into the browser's console.
consoleDisplay.label: Console Display

consoleEnabled.description: Whether TrackJS should wrap and watch the console for events. If disabled, window.console is not guaranteed to exist in all browsers.
consoleEnabled.label: Console Enabled

consoleError.description: Whether TrackJS should transmit errors on calls to console.error.
consoleError.label: Console Error

enabled.description: Whether to enable TrackJS for the page. If false, the TrackJS watchers will not be set up. The window.trackJs API will still be available and function locally, but no errors will be transmitted from the browser
enabled.label: Enabled

networkEnabled.description: Whether TrackJS should wrap and watch AJAX calls. If disabled, network events will not appear in your Telemetry Timeline.
networkEnabled.label: Network Enabled

networkError.description: Whether TrackJS should transmit errors when an AJAX call completes with a 'failing' status code, 400 or greater. If you wish to customize the list of status codes you want to capture errors from, set this to true and filter out status codes using the onError callback.
networkError.label: Network Error

token.description: You can find your token under Track JS [setup page](https://my.trackjs.com/customer/setup#install-locally).
token.label: Token
validators: Please double-check your token, it should be 32 characters long and look something like `c15932a25c4649f9b3505ab5c62b0ea5`

visitorEnabled.description: Whether TrackJS should watch visitor interaction events, such as clicks and field input.
visitorEnabled.label: Visitor Enabled

windowEnabled.description: Whether TrackJS should watch window.onerror for global errors
windowEnabled.label: Window Enabled
